page.title: 16TOURISM - HEDINGHAM
page.content: Many tourists are attracted to this area, mainly to see the Norman Keep which was built by the de Vere family. In the centre of the village is the 12th c. church of St. Nicholas. The surrounding streets and houses date from the 16th c. In the village square is a Youth Hostel which is used often in the summer especially by cyclists. There are one or two private houses offering Bed and Breakfast. There is a Pottery which is open to the public, and in the old school buildings a specialist silk weaving mill is now well established and can be visited by appointment. Shops and restaurants cater for the Tourists. The Colne Valley Railway on the A604 is a preservation centre for steam engines with a mile long track, restaurants and a picnic area.
